thread.title: Credit Where It’s Due: Bond-Buyers Get Pickier
thread.title_full: Credit Where It’s Due: Bond-Buyers Get Pickier - WSJ

author: Richard Barley
title: Credit Where It’s Due: Bond-Buyers Get Pickier
text:
For years, supportive global monetary policy meant corporate bond investors could take a wide-angle macroeconomic view of credit quality. But it is increasingly time to go close-up. Bond markets are clearly becoming pickier.
The third quarter marked something of a turning point in Europe on this front. Investors are paying more attention to the prospects of individual companies. One measure of that is greater price differences between bonds: The price gap between the median euro-denominated high-yield bond in the iBoxx... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
